name: Casimir Lundberg
profile_summary: A software developer with a strong foundation in responsibility and precision, gained in the aviation industry. Used to working as part of a team and has learned to quickly assimilate new technologies while studying at Hive Helsinki. Has a curious, childlike mind and loves solving problems. Eager to demonstrate new skill set and contribute to the tech industry.

professional.background: Aviation professional transitioning to software development

education.program: Intensive Software Development and Administration Program
education.description: Including a diverse set of problems to solve using a range of technologies

detailed_info.philosophy: More than a coding school - a place where you grow skills, connections, and confidence to thrive in tech and beyond

learning_approach.method: Peer-to-peer learning with no traditional teachers
learning_approach.style: Learning through exploration, trial and error, and active doing
learning_approach.collaboration: Students collaborate together, share knowledge, and support each other

transformation.technical: Rigorous, practical curriculum rooted in real projects for 18 months
transformation.professional: Graduates as resilient, adaptable, self-driven lifelong learners

curriculum.focus: Programming fundamentals with critical assessment of when to use new tools/technologies vs fundamentals
curriculum.outcome: Technical expertise and confidence to contribute from day one, regardless of stack

community.ecosystem: Vibrant community connected to tech industry
community.learning_sources: Masterclasses and workshops with professionals, alumni, and industry leaders
community.networking: Lasting relationships and practical industry insights

entrepreneurship.culture: Lab for technical founders fostering creativity, speed, and innovation
entrepreneurship.activities: Hackathons, challenges, rapid prototyping, and testing
entrepreneurship.mindset: Failure is expected and encouraged, making founding a startup feel inspiring and realistic

results.employer_satisfaction: 98% grade Hivers as good or excellent

responsibilities: Aircraft weight and balance Instructor and Officer, responsible for load planning and performing weight and balance calculations for aircraft
Instructed both manual and computerized weight and balance methods, according to industry standards
Responsible for establishing Helsinki as a centralized load control hub, managing weight and balance for other stations
Coordinated daily ground operations for multiple client airlines, including ad-hoc flights
Worked closely with client airlines to ensure seamless operations
System administration of the Departure Control System (DCS), including system configuration and user management of 200+ users
Defined and maintained business rules in the system, liaised with the service provider, and carefully managed user access due to sensitive information
Responsible for setting up new systems and infrastructure (such as self-service bag drop and check-in machines)
Learned the importance of precision, and the need to double-check all work
Gained broad insight into various systems used across the aviation industry
Provided customer service at check-in for several international airlines
Oversaw flight turnaround coordination at gates, ensuring on time departures and high level of customer service
Also responsible for teaching gate coordination, and upholding relevant documentation
Learnt how to cope in high stress environments, and how to manage challenging customer interactions

projects.name: Transcendence
projects.description: Final project at Hive Helsinki - a full-stack PONG web application
details: Collaborative team project as the capstone of Hive Helsinki program
Full-stack web application centered around the classic PONG game
Comprehensive user management and authentication system
Real-time multiplayer functionality
Tournament system and AI opponents
Modern web technologies and containerized deployment

projects.name: WebPONG
projects.description: Personal fork of Transcendence - a full-stack web project built around PONG
projects.project_relationship: WebPONG is Casimir's personal fork of the Transcendence project, allowing him to continue developing and experimenting with features independently
details: Using TypeScript, React and Tailwind in frontend
Using Fastify, Prisma and SQLite in backend
User management with secure JWT and MFA via OTP
Two player matches, single player vs AI, Tournaments
Match customization
Full screen-reader accessibility (ARIA standards)
Multi-language support

projects.name: Webserv
projects.description: An HTTP1.1 webserver written in C++
details: Learned the inner workings of webservers, including configuration parsing, response handling and connection management
Implemented support for CGI scripts written in Python
Learned Socket programming, I/O Handling and Network protocols
Designed protection against a range of malformed input

projects.name: MiniBash
projects.description: A BASH inspired shell written in C
details: Implemented input parsing with support for pipes, heredocs, file I/O redirection, and environment variables
Process Management using (fork(), waitpid() and execve())
Ensured efficient memory management with no leaks
Rigorous testing, to ensure reliability
Built custom builtins: cd, pwd, export, unset, env, echo and exit
Signal handling

projects.name: Cube3D
details: Implemented map parsing, Raycasting, texture mapping
Using a graphics library
Multithreading for efficiency
Animated sprite rendering

projects.name: Born2BeRoot
details: Setting up a Linux server
Managing users and user rights in Linux
Creating monitoring scripts (using different methods like cron jobs etc.)
Using SSH and setting up ports
Overall operations and commands in a Linux environment

projects.name: Philosophers
details: Multithreading with high precision
Mutexes and careful synchronization to avoid deadlock and data races

personal.philosophy: A happy and laughing mind is a productive mind

pets.coding_companion: She doesn't let me code without having her in my lap or on my shoulders - she's my dedicated programming supervisor!

hobbies: Personal/side projects (always has something going on)
personal.free_time: Enjoying life with my two daughters
personal.computer_history: First computer was a Commodore 64 which I LOVED as a small child (got it from an older friend). Always have been into computers and adept at them.

travel.experience: Used to backpack around Southeast Asia a lot before kids

personal.career_focus: Full-stack developer, leaning more towards backend
personal.future_goals: Having a software developer job and being able to fully commit to that area
personal.work_style: Very social and thrives when working in tandem with others
